holidays.name: Fluffernutter Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the iconic sandwich made from peanut butter and marshmallow fluff! It's a delightfully sticky and sweet treat beloved mostly in the Northeastern U.S.
holidays.origin: This quirky food holiday originated to honor the marshmallow fluff created in the early 1900s and the classic sandwich combinations that followed.
holidays.funFact: During World War II, marshmallow fluff was packed in soldiers' rations alongside peanut butter, making the fluffernutter a wartime favorite!

holidays.name: National Smile Day
holidays.description: A day to share your brightest, quirkiest, or goofiest grin with the world. Smiling not only boosts your mood but can be downright contagious!
holidays.origin: Created by a smile enthusiast to encourage positivity and happiness worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Psychologists have found that simply smiling—even if you’re not happy—can trick your brain into feeling better.

holidays.name: World Octopus Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the fascinating sea creature known for its intelligence and eight arms. It's a day to appreciate octopuses in oceans, aquariums, and mythologies!
holidays.origin: An unofficial global observance embraced by marine biologists and sea lovers to raise awareness about ocean conservation.
holidays.funFact: Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood, making them some of the most uniquely endowed creatures on the planet.

holidays.name: Do Something Nice Day
holidays.description: A gentle nudge to spread kindness, perform random acts of generosity, or brighten someone's day with a smile or helpful gesture.
holidays.origin: An unofficial day promoted by various kindness organizations to encourage goodwill year-round.
holidays.funFact: Acts of kindness release endorphins in the brain, creating what’s called the “helper’s high.” Doing good feels good!
